body.p: How does the blood in the pulmonary artery compare to blood in the systemic arteries?

feedback.p: Blood in the pulmonary artery is less oxygenated than the blood in the systemic arteries. This is reversed in the venous vessels, where the pulmonary veins carry blood that is more oxygenated than the systemic veins.

hint.p: Think about where the pulmonary or systemic arteries are carrying the blood and what will happen there.

explanation.p: Blood in the pulmonary artery is less oxygenated than the blood in the systemic arteries. This is reversed in the venous vessels, where the pulmonary veins carry blood that is more oxygenated than the systemic veins.
